TOPICS.title: NMWSO Digital Safety Resource Helper
TOPICS.description: Comprehensive interactive guide for Online Gender-Based Violence (OGBV), Harassment, Impersonation, and Doxxing.

q_situation_triage.question: Which of the following best describes your current situation?

options.label: Someone is making me feel unsafe online
My family member / friend / colleague is feeling unsafe online

q_auth_check.question: Are you this person's legal guardian or do you have power of attorney on their behalf?

end_no_auth.title: Authorization Needed
end_no_auth.content: Got it. Unfortunately, you can't pursue any legal action on their behalf without proper authorization. However, we can help you understand what they might have access to and point you to additional non-legal resources.

q_main_category_rep.question: Which of the following best describes what is making them feel unsafe online?

options.label: Images or videos of them online that shouldn't be
Someone is harassing or threatening them
Personal information or photos they don't want public is circulating online

q_main_category.question: Which of the following best describes what is making you feel unsafe online?

options.label: Images or videos of me online that shouldn't be
Someone is harassing or threatening me
Personal information or photos that I don't want public is circulating online

q_img_nature.question: Got it. I can help you take a few simple steps to feel safer. First, select which applies best to the images/videos:

options.label: I suspect the images were digitally produced, altered, or doctored (Deepfakes)
The images are humiliating, defamatory, or threatening
The images were obtained secretly or without my consent (Voyeurism)
The images contain intimate or explicit materials

res_img_laws_deepfake.title: Potential Violation: Anti-Cybercrime Act
res_img_laws_deepfake.content: If the images were digitally produced, altered, edited, or doctored, this could be a violation of the Anti-Cybercrime Act.

res_img_laws_safe_spaces.title: Potential Violation: Safe Spaces Act
res_img_laws_safe_spaces.content: If the images or videos in question are humiliating, defamatory, or threatening in nature, this could be a violation of the Safe Spaces Act.

res_img_laws_privacy.title: Potential Violation: Data Privacy Act
res_img_laws_privacy.content: If the images or videos in question are using your identity to impersonate you, this could be a violation of the Data Privacy Act.

res_img_laws_voyeur.title: Potential Violation: Anti-Photo/Video Voyeurism Act
res_img_laws_voyeur.content: If the images or videos in question were obtained secretly or without your consent, this could be a violation of the Anti-Photo/Video Voyeurism Act.

res_img_laws_intimate.title: Potential Violation: Safe Spaces / Voyeurism
res_img_laws_intimate.content: If the images contain intimate or explicit materials, this could be a violation of the Safe Spaces Act, Anti-Photo/Video Voyeurism Act, and other special protections.

res_img_laws_minor.title: Potential Violation: Anti-OSAEC / Anti-Child Abuse
res_img_laws_minor.content: If the images contain minors (children under the age of 18), this could be a violation of the Anti-OSAEC Law, Anti-Child Abuse Law, and you may be entitled to special protections.

menu_actions_img.title: What You Can Do
menu_actions_img.content: There are a few things you can do to help feel safer and simplify things. Click one of the options below to explore more:

links.label: Contact Law Enforcement / File Criminal Complaint
Submit a Takedown Request to the Platform

q_danger_check.question: That is very unsettling. Are you in immediate danger?

options.label: No, but I'd like to feel safer

end_emergency.title: Emergency Action Required
end_emergency.content: Please find a safe space and contact the police right away. If you need sensitive assistance regarding gender-based issues, you can ask for your local VAWC Desk. If you fear for some reason contact with local police, contact PNP Anti-Cybercrime Group.

q_harass_details.question: Got it. I can help you take a few simple steps to feel safer. First, select all that apply:

options.label: Harassment involves repeated and unwanted contact via digital means
Harassment involves threats of physical, reputational, or financial harm
Harassment is directed to a woman and/or child
Harassment is coming from a current or former intimate partner

res_harass_cyber.title: Potential Violation: Anti-Cybercrime Act
res_harass_cyber.content: The harassment/threats involve repeated and unwanted contact through digital means. This could be a violation of the Anti-Cybercrime Act.

res_harass_threats.title: Potential Violation: Grave Threats (Article 282)
res_harass_threats.content: If the harassment involves threats of physical, reputational, or financial harm, this could be a violation of Article 282 (Grave Threats).

res_harass_safe_spaces.title: Potential Violation: Safe Spaces Act
res_harass_safe_spaces.content: If the harassment is directed to a woman and/or child, this could be a violation of the Safe Spaces Act.

res_harass_vawc.title: Potential Violation: Anti-VAWC Laws
res_harass_vawc.content: If the harassment is coming from a current or former intimate partner, this could be a violation of Anti-VAWC Laws (RA 9262).

menu_actions_harass.title: What You Can Do
menu_actions_harass.content: To feel safer, consider these options:

q_imp_method.question: How is this person impersonating you?

options.label: Using my address or phone number

res_imp_security.title: Secure Your Accounts
res_imp_security.content: If your login information has been exposed, please change your passwords immediately and enable Two-Factor Authentication (2FA) on all accounts.

res_imp_action.title: Report Impersonation
res_imp_action.content: It sounds like you will need to resolve this directly with the platform or person in question. We can help you prepare a formal complaint based on the information you've provided, or we can help connect you to other resources.

q_dox_identify.question: Does this info identify you? (name, address, phone, workplace, IDs, accounts)

end_dox_frustrating.title: Privacy Advice
end_dox_frustrating.content: That is frustrating. Even if it doesn't strictly identify you, you can try to protect your privacy by reporting the content to the platform and adjusting your privacy settings.

q_dox_consent.question: Do you have any reason to suspect that the individual or entity circulating this information has either your CONSENT or a LEGAL BASIS to do so?

end_dox_check_legal.title: Check Legal Basis
end_dox_check_legal.content: Sometimes, individuals or entities may have received your consent (e.g., via Terms of Service) or have a legal basis (public officials). If you are unsure, you may need to consult a lawyer.

q_dox_15_days.question: Have you taken measures to resolve this directly with the violator/platform AND has it been 15 days since you attempted to resolve it?

options.label: Yes, but I have not heard back / not resolved

q_dox_exceptions.question: Do any of the following apply? 1. Serious/irreparable harm. 2. Violator cannot offer remedy. 3. Action is clearly illegal.

end_dox_wait.title: Exhaustion of Remedies
end_dox_wait.content: Generally, you can't file a complaint with the Data Privacy commission until you've attempted to resolve the issue directly with the person/entity and waited 15 days.

q_dox_computer.question: To your knowledge, was the information collected or circulated via a computer system?

res_dox_npc.title: Data Privacy Violation
res_dox_npc.content: It sounds like what you're experiencing could be a violation of the Data Privacy Act (RA 10173). We can help you draft a formal complaint.

res_dox_offline.title: Offline/Other Violation
res_dox_offline.content: If this didn't happen via a computer system, it might not be a Data Privacy Act violation, but could still be illegal. Consult legal counsel.
